parts.text: The checkout-service SLO error budget is nearly exhausted. We have a 99.9% availability SLO and we're at 99.85% for this month. Investigate what's burning the budget.

Investigation complete. The error budget burn rate spiked 4x on Feb 3 due to a deployment that introduced a null pointer exception in the payment validation path. This single event consumed 60% of the remaining monthly budget. The deployment was rolled back on Feb 4 but the damage was done. I recommend implementing a canary deployment strategy and adding pre-deployment SLO impact checks.
Multiple SLOs are showing violations in the last 24 hours across 3 services. Give me a unified analysis.

Unified SLO analysis complete. The root cause is shared: a degraded Cloud SQL instance caused cascading latency violations across the API gateway (latency SLO), order-service (availability SLO), and notification-service (throughput SLO). All three depend on the same database tier. I recommend implementing circuit breakers for database calls and provisioning read replicas.
